<metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>NOAA National Marine Fisheries Service</origin>     <pubdate>Unpublished Material</pubdate>     <title Sync="TRUE">Acropora_CH_po</title>     <geoform Sync="TRUE">vector digital data</geoform>     <onlink>\\\\SERO-NOVELL-4\\DATA1\\GIS\\ESRI CATALOG\\ARCDATA\\PRODUCTS\\Distribution\\AcroporaCH</onlink>     <ftname Sync="TRUE">Acropora_CH_po</ftname></citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>These data represent the critical habitat for elkhorn coral (Acropora palmata) and staghorn coral (A. cervicornis) as designated by 73 FR 72210, November 26, 2008, Rules and Regulations.</abstract>    <purpose>The purpose of these data is to visually represent the critical habitat areas for GIS analysis and display.</purpose>    <langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>20081126</caldate>      <time>0900</time>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>ground condition</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>As needed</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc Sync="TRUE">-83.120607</westbc>     <eastbc Sync="TRUE">-64.438286</eastbc>     <northbc Sync="TRUE">26.545134</northbc>     <southbc Sync="TRUE">17.637457</southbc>    </bounding>    <lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">-83.120607</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">-64.438286</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">17.637457</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">26.545134</topbc></lboundng></spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>Acropora palmata</themekey>     <themekey>Acropora cervicornis</themekey>     <themekey>Critical Habitat</themekey>     <themekey>Endangered Species</themekey>     <themekey>GIS</themekey>     <themekey>staghorn coral</themekey><themekey>elkhorn coral</themekey></theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Caribbean</placekey>     <placekey>Puerto Rico</placekey>     <placekey>Virgin Islands</placekey><placekey>St. John</placekey><placekey>St. Thomas</placekey><placekey>St. Croix</placekey><placekey>Florida</placekey><placekey>Florida Keys</placekey><placekey>Palm Beach County</placekey><placekey>Broward County</placekey><placekey>Miami-Dade County</placekey><placekey>Monroe County</placekey><placekey>Atlantic Ocean</placekey><placekey>Caribbean Sea</placekey></place>    <stratum>    </stratum>   </keywords>   <accconst>None</accconst>   <useconst>Users be advised that the accuracy of this data set is completely dependent upon the accuracy of the shoreline and bathymetric data used in the creation process. For more details on this process, see the process description. The text description in 73 FR 72210 is always the one, true definition of Acropora critical habitat. These or any other depictions are for information purposes only and shouldn't be relied on for regulatory purposes.</useconst>   <ptcontac>    <cntinfo>     <cntpos>Acropora Coordinator</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>      <address>263 13th Avenue South</address>      <city>St. Petersburg</city>      <state>FL</state>      <postal>33071-5505</postal>      <country>USA</country>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>727-824-5312</cntvoice>     <cntfax>727-824-5309</cntfax>     <cntemail>Jennifer.Moore@noaa.gov</cntemail>     <hours>Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm</hours>     <cntperp><cntper>Jennifer Moore</cntper><cntorg>NOAA-National Marine Fisheries Service</cntorg></cntperp></cntinfo>   </ptcontac>   <native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000</native>   <crossref>    <citeinfo>    </citeinfo>   </crossref>   <natvform Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</natvform></idinfo>  <dataqual>   <logic>Not Applicable</logic>   <complete>Complete Pending NMFS PRD Review</complete>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <qhorizpa>     </qhorizpa>    </horizpa>   </posacc>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Bathymetry source: NGDC Coastal Relief Model for Puerto Rico & Virgin Islands (Vol. 9), and Florida and Eastern Gulf of Mexico (Vol. 3). Using ESRI's ArcGIS ArcMap software and Spatial Analyst extension, ran the 'Surface Analysis' tool, 'Contour'. Set contour interval to 30 (CRM is in tenths of meters). The contour line was a bit blocky, so smoothed using ET GeoWizard (3rd party software) to smooth the contour using Bezier Curve smoothing algorithm with default settings (5 for smoothness) for the Caribbean and 10 for smoothing setting for Florida, and then cleaned. Converted the polyline to a polygon. Deleted very small polygons/ or polys for depths +/- 1m.</procdesc>     <srcused>National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Geodetic Data Center (NGDC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Department of Commerce</srcused>     <procdate>20071030</procdate>     <proccont>      <cntinfo>       <cntorgp>        <cntorg>NOAA-NMFS</cntorg>        <cntper>Amanda Frick</cntper>       </cntorgp>       <cntpos>GIS Analyst/Contractor</cntpos>       <cntaddr>        <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>        <address>263 13th Avenue South</address>        <city>St. Petersburg</city>        <state>FL</state>        <postal>33701-5505</postal>        <country>USA</country>       </cntaddr>       <cntvoice>727-824-5312</cntvoice>       <cntfax>727-824-5309</cntfax>       <cntemail>Amanda.Frick@noaa.gov</cntemail>       <hours>Monday - Friday, 8:30am - 5:30pm</hours>      </cntinfo>     </proccont>    </procstep>    <procstep><procdesc>Used detailed shoreline for Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands from NOAA National Centers for Coastal Ocean Science (NCCOS), by selecting  'Land' and 'mangrove' polygons. Used NOAA medium resolution vector shoreline for Florida to create land polygon. Erased the bathymetry polygons with the land/mangrove polygons .  For Florida shoreline, or shoreward side of the critical habitat polygon, used Florida Fish & Wildlife Commission (FWC) for nearshore bathymetry (digitized from NOAA nautical charts) for the 6 ft depth to Government Cut, FWC 1:24,000 scale shoreline, COLREG lines, and intercouncil boundary between South Atlantic and Gulf of Mexico Fishery Management Councils at the mouths of bays and inlets, and information from the U.S. Navy for exclusions. The polygon that included to the 30 meter contour was erased with the appropriate data for the shoreward side.</procdesc><date Sync="TRUE">20050816</date><time Sync="TRUE">13330600</time><srcused>Florida Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Centers for Coastal Ocean Science (NCCOS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Department of Commerce - Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Designation of Critical Habitat for Acropora 73 FR 72210, November 26, 2008</srcused><proccont><cntinfo><cntaddr><address>NOAA Fisheries Service</address><addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype><address>263 13th Ave S</address><city>St. Petersburg</city><state>FL</state><postal>33701</postal><country>USA</country></cntaddr><cntperp><cntper>Amanda Frick</cntper><cntorg>NOAA-NMFS</cntorg></cntperp><cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos><cntvoice>727-824-5312</cntvoice><cntfax>727-8245309</cntfax><cntemail>amanda.frick@noaa.gov</cntemail><hours>8:00 am - 5:00 pm</hours></cntinfo></proccont></procstep><procstep><procdesc>The process of creating an outer boundary using the gridded bathymetry data produced polygons with very dense veritices. ET GeoWizards (3rd party software) was used to generalize the polygons, using the Douglas-Poiker algorithm. A generalize tolerance of .00001 arc seconds was assigned.</procdesc><procdate>03/12/2009</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc Sync="TRUE">Dataset copied.</procdesc><srcused Sync="TRUE">Q:\\PRODUCTS\\Distribution\\Acropora_CH_po</srcused><procdate Sync="TRUE">20090904</procdate><proctime Sync="TRUE">10395200</proctime></procstep></lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>
